Class MachineLearning

java.lang.Object
MachineLearning
public class MachineLearning
extends java.lang.Object
Class to implement different similarity functions as well as a K-Nearest Neighbor algorithm and K-Means Clustering algorithm
Version:
1.0.0 17 SEPT 2020
Author:
cjsindt

    Calculates the dot product (inner product) of two given vectors given as 2 arrays of doubles

    Calculates the Euclidean Distance between two vectors of the same dimensionality.

  • Constructor Details

    • MachineLearning

      public MachineLearning()

  • Method Details

    • cosineSimilarity

      public double cosineSimilarity​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2)
      Calculates the cosine similarity of 2 vectors. Found by taking the dot product (inner product) over the product of the magnitudes (norms) of the vectors.
      Parameters:
      vector1 - first vector represented as an array of doubles
      vector2 - second vector represented as an array of doubles
      Returns:
      the cosine similarity (value between -1 and 1) if the cosine similarity can be calculated, 2 if otherwise

    • hammingDistance

      public int hammingDistance​(java.lang.String str1, java.lang.String str2)
      Calculates the Hamming Distance between two strings.
      Parameters:
      str1 - first string to compare
      str2 - second string to compare
      Returns:
      the hamming distance if the lengths are equal, -1 if lengths don't equal

    • euclideanDistance

      public double euclideanDistance​(double[] vect1, double[] vect2)
      Calculates the Euclidean Distance between two vectors of the same dimensionality.
      Parameters:
      vect1 - the first vector represented as an array of doubles
      vect2 - the second vector represented as an array of doubles
      Returns:
      the euclidean distance between the vectors if they are not null and have the same length, -1 otherwise

    • dotProduct

      private double dotProduct​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2)
      Calculates the dot product (inner product) of two given vectors given as 2 arrays of doubles
      Parameters:
      vector1 - an array of doubles for the 1st vector
      vector2 - an array of doubles for the 2nd vector
      Returns:
      the dot product (inner product) of the two vectors if they are the same length and non-zero, Double.MAX_VALUE otherwise

    • magnitude

      private double magnitude​(double[] vector)
      Calculates the Magnitude (Norm) of the given vector given as an array of doubles
      Parameters:
      vector - an array of doubles representing a vector
      Returns:
      the magnitude (norm) of the vector

    • kNearestNeighbors

      public java.lang.String kNearestNeighbors​(java.lang.String filePath, double[] feats, int k)
      Classifies a given data point based on the provided dataset using K-Nearest Neighbors. Designed to run the included dataset (S27-MLMedium.csv)
      Parameters:
      filePath - path to the dataset
      feats - features of the new datapoint to classify
      k - the k term
      Returns:
      a string describing what class the point is classified to

    • kMeansClustering

      public void kMeansClustering​(java.lang.String filePath, int k)
      Classifies data points into k clusters using K-Means Clustering.
      Parameters:
      filePath - file path to data set
      k - amount of clusters

    • isIn

      private boolean isIn​(int[] nums, int i)
      Checks if the given value i is in the given array nums. For use in kMeansClustering
      Parameters:
      nums - the array to check
      i - the value to check
      Returns:
      true if i is in nums, false otherwise
